title: Green Thumb Garden Designer
description: Built using the MEAN stack, the garden designer app allows the user to create a one-of-a-kind garden layout using simple drag and drop gestures. The garden options take advantage of AngularJS's two-way data binding to instantly change the layout according to user input. Multiple Bootstrap components are used including accordions, popovers, and modals.

title: General Assembly Bootcamp
description: General Assembly's Web Development Immersive program was an intense, but amazing, 12-week learning experience. I completed the program with a solid foundation of programming principles such as object oriented programming, MVC frameworks, and test driven development in both front end and back end languages.

title: Angular Portfolio Page
description: This portfolio website you're looking at was built with Angular. It's got a controller, a service, and multiple views. I am using ui-router to route between the various views/states.

title: Photos of Paul
description: This Ruby on Rails photo sharing app is dedicated to guys named Paul. Create an account to comment and favorite photos from the gallery or even upload your own to Amazon Web Services. The app uses various Ruby gems for user authorization (Cancancan), password hashing (Bcrypt), and file upload (Paperclip).

title: Address Book
description: This single page Ruby on Rails app uses Bootstrap Modals and AJAX calls to connect to the Rails backend without refreshing the page.

title: JQuery Memory Game
description: A memory game built with JQuery. The first project I did in bootcamp.
